name: Cariprazine

dosing.adult_acute: Schizophrenia: 1.5 mg once daily; Bipolar mania: 1.5 mg once daily; Bipolar depression: 1.5 mg once daily
dosing.notes: Very long half-life (1-3 weeks); effects persist weeks after discontinuation; partial agonist at D2/D3; FDA-approved for bipolar depression

canadian_clinical.titration_schedule: Increase by 1.5 mg increments; wait â‰¥2 weeks between adjustments due to long half-life
canadian_clinical.inpatient_strategy: Start 1.5-3 mg daily; slow titration due to long half-life; effect may take 2-4 weeks
canadian_clinical.outpatient_strategy: Start 1.5 mg daily; increase every 2+ weeks; excellent for bipolar depression or negative symptoms

warnings: Black box warning: Increased mortality in elderly with dementia-related psychosis
VERY long half-life (1-3 weeks with active metabolites) - clinical effects persist weeks after stopping
Akathisia common (15-20%) - most common reason for discontinuation
Weight gain and metabolic effects (moderate, less than olanzapine/quetiapine)
Approved for bipolar depression (alternative to quetiapine/lurasidone)
May help negative symptoms of schizophrenia (D3 partial agonism)

cautions.renal: No adjustment for mild-moderate; not recommended if CrCl <30
cautions.hepatic: Not recommended in severe hepatic impairment
